bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Edwin F. Uhl, June 7, 1894
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 7, 1894.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU RECEIVED JUL 19 94 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Receipt of Circular Despatch No 53, and report on same.
Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, June 7, 1894.
Honorable Edwin F. Uhl, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: In accordance with your Circular Despatch No 53, dated April 9, 1894, seeking information in reference to taxes rates or taxes levied on shipping in my Consular district. I have the honor to transmit the accompanying, which has just reached the Consulate General from the treasury department of Liberia.
I have the honor to be Sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul.
